what: Incorperating Effective Functional Flows into R2R
title: Functional Flow Analysis
text: Reorienting Recovery Structured Decision Making group proposed effective functional flow (EFF) scenario. date, available CalSIM EFF run model full EFF entire system. document outlines approach piloting EFF Sacramento River. Pilot EFF Approach Sacramento River R2R technical team working collaboratively flow sub group develop EFF hydrograph Sacramento River. building Nature Conservancy’s Natural Flows Database develop wet dry year monthly EFF hydrographs. compile wet dry year EFF 20 year synthetic timeserries based historical water year types 1980 2000, current R2R model timeframe. Planned Improvements Next Steps technical team working review existing literature pulse flows expand pulse flow routing logic model. increase granularity flow related model effects despite monthly timestep CalSim flow input data model. technical team also working MBK incoperate EFF logic CalSIM Run can use directly model.

previous_headings: Incorperating Effective Functional Flows into R2R
title: Functional Flow Analysis
text: California’s EFF include 5 distinct components natural flow regime: fall pulse flows, wet season peak flows, wet season base flows, spring recession flows, dry season baseflows.  information EFF please refer additional sources: Modeling Functional Flows California’s Rivers California Environmental Flows Framework Natural Flows Database

previous_headings: Incorperating Effective Functional Flows into R2R
what: How can we tailor EFF to our system
title: Functional Flow Analysis
text: EFF hypothesized best flows salmon historical system. However, system highly managed may need alter EFF slightly historical values maximize benefit salmon. R2R techncial team developed proposed EFF monthly flows combining Natural Flows Database values critical flow survival migratory thresholds Sacramento River (Michel 2021).

previous_headings: Incorperating Effective Functional Flows into R2R > How can we tailor EFF to our system

title: Functional Flow Analysis
text: table shows monthly flow CFS dry year model EFF Sacramento River. table constructed using Natural Flows database model survival thresholds. plot shows CalSIM modeled flows Sacramento River existing representative dry year: 1987 1987 median water year index provided DWR “Critical”, “Dry”, “Normal” years within model time frame.  table shows annual total volume water needed flow scenario. dry year EFF uses less water Natural Flows database EFF representative CalSIM year.

previous_headings: Modeled Flow Data for the Reorienting to Recovery DSM models
title: Modeled Flow Data for the R2R Salmonid Life Cycle Models
text: Output CALSIM II operational model used generate hydrologic inputs CVPIA Decision Support Model (DSM). CALSIM II model used simulate California State Water Project (SWP) / Central Valley Project (CVP) operations. CALSIM II developed Water Resource Integrated Modeling System (WRIMS model engine WRIMS), generalized water resources modeling system evaluating operational alternatives large, complex river basins. Data objects package contain information CalSim II run 2009 CalSim II run 2019, exploratory Run River CalSim run. datasets produced using CalSim outputs filtered years 1980-2000 match timeserries Life Cycle Models. See documentation information access data objects run. CalSim II run used basis comparison potential operations offset impacts listed species. information CALSIM IICALSIM II Schematic

title: Flow in cfs — flows_cfs
text: flow represented using 'FLOW-CHANNEL' 'FLOW-DELIVERY' nodes CALSIM II. nodes calculation watershed outlined . Sutter Yolo Bypasses' flows stored separate dataset bypass_flows enable habitat segmentation bypasses according weir locations. Lower-mid Sacramento River two nodes, one Fremont Weir (C134) one (C160). calculating habitat Lower-Mid Sacramento river, calculate habitat flow node sum proportion length stream weir: $$35.6/58 * (habitat C134) + 22.4/58 * (habitat C160)$$ *modeled flows Bear Creek, flows Paynes Creek used **Mokelumne River flow separate model provided EBMUD. CALSIM II schematic

Diversions creeks estimated proportion flow. Elder Creek Thomes Creek also represented single node diversions estimated using method. Upper Sacramento River D104 / C104 Antelope Creek (C11307 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) / C11307 Battle Creek modeled diversions Bear Creek modeled diversions Big Chico Creek modeled diversions Butte Creek (C217B + D217) / (C217B + D217 + C217A) Clear Creek modeled diversions Cottonwood Creek modeled diversions Cow Creek modeled diversions Deer Creek (C11309 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) / C11309 Elder Creek (C11303 / (C11303 + C11304) * D11301) / C11303 Mill Creek (C11308 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) / C11308 Paynes Creek modeled diversions Stony Creek D17301 / C42 Thomes Creek (C11304 / (C11303 + C11304) * D11301) / C11304 Upper-mid Sacramento River (D109 + D112 + D113A + D113B + D114 + D118 + D122A + D122B + D123 + D124A + D128_WTS + D128) / C110 Sutter Bypass modeled diversions Bear River D285 / (C285 + D285) Feather River (D201 + D202 + D7A + D7B) / C6 Yuba River D230 / (C230 + D230) Lower-mid Sacramento River (D129A + D134 + D162 + D165) / C128 Yolo Bypass modeled diversions American River D302 / C9 Lower Sacramento River (D167 + D168 + D168A_WTS) / C166 Calaveras River (D506A + D506B + D506C + D507) / C92 Cosumnes River modeled diversions Mokelumne River (D503A + D503B + D503C + D502A + D502B) / C91* Merced River (D562 + D566) / C561 Stanislaus River D528 / C520 Tuolumne River D545 / C540 San Joaquin River (D637 + D630B + D630A + D620B) / (D637 + D630B + D630A + D620B + C637) *Mokelumne River flow diversions separate model provided EBMUD. title: SWP Exports — swp_exports
text: Total exports SWP cms three separate Calsim runs. Values obtained using CALSIM variable DEL_SWP_EXP. Data Calsim run stored separate elements named list, named Calsim  run came : biop_2008_2009: output 2008-2009 Calsim II BiOp run. biop_itp_2018_2019: output 2018-2019 Calsim II BiOp run. calsim_run_of_river: output Calsim Run River run.

text: named list element contains matrix months (1-12) rows years (1980-1999) columns

title: Total Flow Diverted — total_diverted
text: named list datasets containing diverted flow cms within watersheds use CVPIA SIT Salmon Population Model. components list contain output three different Calsim runs: biop_2008_2009: output 2008-2009 Calsim II BiOp run. biop_itp_2018_2019: output 2018-2019 Calsim II BiOp run. calsim_run_of_river: output Calsim Run River run.

title: Total Flow Diverted — total_diverted
text: proportion diverted calculated using 'FLOW-CHANNEL' 'FLOW-DELIVERY' nodes CALSIM II. nodes calculation watershed outlined diversions Antelope Creek, Deer Creek Mill Creek represented one diversion node. Diversions creeks estimated proportion flow. Elder Creek Thomes Creek also represented single node diversions estimated using method. Upper Sacramento River D104 Antelope Creek (C11307 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) Battle Creek modeled diversions Bear Creek modeled diversions Big Chico Creek modeled diversions Butte Creek (C217B + D217) Clear Creek modeled diversions Cottonwood Creek modeled diversions Cow Creek modeled diversions Deer Creek (C11309 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) Elder Creek (C11303 / (C11303 + C11304) * D11301) Mill Creek (C11308 / (C11307 + C11308 + C11309) * D11305) Paynes Creek modeled diversions Stony Creek D17301 Thomes Creek (C11304 / (C11303 + C11304) * D11301) Upper-mid Sacramento River (D109 + D112 + D113A + D113B + D114 + D118 + D122A + D122B + D123 + D124A + D128_WTS + D128) Sutter Bypass modeled diversions Bear River D285 Feather River (D201 + D202 + D7A + D7B) Yuba River D230 Lower-mid Sacramento River (D129A + D134 + D162 + D165) Yolo Bypass modeled diversions American River D302 Lower Sacramento River (D167 + D168 + D168A_WTS) Calaveras River (D506A + D506B + D506C + D507) Cosumnes River modeled diversions Mokelumne River (D503A + D503B + D503C + D502A + D502B)* Merced River (D562 + D566) Stanislaus River D528 Tuolumne River D545 San Joaquin River (D637 + D630B + D630A + D620B) *Mokelumne River flow diversions separate model provided EBMUD. CALSIM II schematic
